did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Letters of Turner Ashby 1852-1863 and undated
did.physdesc: This collection consists of 28 letters (a few with envelopes), a petition, and two photographs of portraits of Turner Ashby.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of 28 letters (a few with envelopes), a petition, and two photographs of portraits of Turner Ashby, 1852-1863 and undated. The letters comprise correspondence between relatives of Turner Ashby including his mother, Dorothea F. Ashby; his sisters, Mary and Dora (both later married to Moncures); cousins; and friends of the family. Two letters are from Turner himself.

did.unittitle: Dated Letters.
D.F.A to "My dear Child". August 1852

scopecontent.p: Explains what Turner Ashby is doing as he stays at Mrs.Grayson's house. There is mention of a gathering at the Spring and the expected arrival of Mary. [D.F.A. is probably Dorothea F. Ashby, Turner's mother.]

did.unittitle: M Allen to "My dear Madam". Aug. 9th, 1853

scopecontent.p: Reply to a letter to Bettie who was ill; plans of different friends; some speakers from Baltimore.

did.unittitle: Dora to "My darling Mother". Oct. 27, 1853

scopecontent.p: A recount of opera, Crystal Palace, & Lt. Nicholas' house suggest trip to New York City. [Dora is the sister of Turner Ashby.]

did.unittitle: From unsigned to "My dearest Mol-". July 28, 1854

scopecontent.p: Written at Argyle; concerns home affairs at Clarke including a drought in the corn, sickness, babies, and servants.

did.unittitle: Turner Ashby to "Dear Dora" written at Raven's Craig. Jan. 14, 1861

scopecontent.p: Hopes to get off for a couple of weeks; gives Dora authority to sign his name concerning the sale of a servant, Louisa; engagement of Milly Stribling [a friend of the family].

did.unittitle: Richard Ashby to "Dear Mama" written from Richmond. March 12th, [1861]

scopecontent.p: Expresses sadness because won't be coming to Stafford although happy in Richmond. Special remembrances to the servants. [Richard is brother of Turner.]

did.unittitle: We the undersigned Ladies of Shepherdstown, Jefferson County, Va to "Lt. Col. Ashby", written at a camp near Duffins Depot. [After June 16, 1861]

scopecontent.p: Petition for protection from the enemy by having one or two companies stationed there.

did.unittitle: Wednesday morning "Dora" to "My Dear Beck" at Markham. Report of weddings, response to kind letter and trip. [Before July 3, 1861]

scopecontent.p: Describes bachelor dinners given to TA before his return to Washington.

did.unittitle: Mary C. Braxton to "Mr. Ashby" [Turner] written from Elmwood. July 15, 1861

scopecontent.p: Condolences for the death of the recipient's brother [probably Richard, on July 3, 1861] during battle; faith of her sister, Harrity, who is taking the death of her idol very hard. [Mary C. Braxton is a friend of the family.]

did.unittitle: Dora Ashby to "Dearest Mary" [on back: Mrs. Mary Moncure] written from Ravenswood to Chelsea. [Before July 22, 1861]

scopecontent.p: Bad weather has kept her from going back to school [to teach]; a party where Annie is flirting like a belle; hi to Mammy and all the servants. In an additional note, D. F. Ashby accepts invitation to move to Chelsea. [Mary is also Turner's sister.]

did.unittitle: Dora Moncure to "My dearest brother"[Turner] written at Ravenswood. July 22nd, [1861]

scopecontent.p: Expresses thanks for the sparing of brother's life at Manassas. Death of brother, Dick, [Richard] who was engaged. Mr. [Powhatan] Moncure is too sick to be drafted.

did.unittitle: Dora to "My Dear Mother" at Chelsea[on back: Mrs. D. F. Ashby]. [July, 1861]

scopecontent.p: Suggests moving and in Dora's state of health cannot take care of the servants. Mentions an overseer; news of Manassas.

did.unittitle: Fanny Ashby to "My Dear Mary" [on back: Mrs. Mary Moncure]. [July, 1861]

scopecontent.p: Concerns about family members; sadness at Mary not coming to Ravenswood. [Cousin of Turner] waiting to hear news of Manassas.

did.unittitle: Harriette Caputon[?] to [on envelope dated Sept. 5 from Union Va: Mrs. Dora A. Moncure], from Elwood. Sept. 4, [1861]

scopecontent.p: Grief at loss of Dora's brother [probably Richard], her "life's happiness". Concern for D.F.A.'s illness.

did.unittitle: Turner Ashby to "Dear Dora" written at Camp Lookout. Sept. 6, 1861

scopecontent.p: Tells of camp duties, skirmishes with the enemy and casualties Ends with "give love to Mary."

did.unittitle: Harriette Caputon[?] to [D.F.Ashby] from Elmwoood. Oct. 4, [1861]

scopecontent.p: Grieves over loss of [Richard]; encouragement that remaining children can be her comfort.

did.unittitle: Friday Evening "Harriete Caputon"[?] to [on envelope: Mrs. Dora A. Moncure] written from Elmwood. [Oct. 5 1861]

scopecontent.p: Response to Dora's letter. Encouraging thoughts for families; grief over [Richard's] death.

did.unittitle: Dora to "my sweet sister." Oct 21st, [1861]

scopecontent.p: Describes home life & having enough to get by. Mentions Fanny as a sister. Good relations with neighbors and friends.

did.unittitle: Dora Moncure to "My Dear Sister" [on back: Mrs. George W. Moncure Chelsea]. [Dec. 25th, 1861]

scopecontent.p: Family matters. Gift exchange on Christmas and bad road conditions. Prescription from Dr. Rase for mother.

did.unittitle: Tuesday "Dora Moncure" to "My Dearest Sister" written from Ravenswood. [Before June 6, 1862]

scopecontent.p: Tells of letters from Robbie and news of Turner and George dispelling rumors of Turner's death. A visit from a Presbyterian Chaplain and other family matters.

did.unittitle: Monday "Susan Shacklett" to "My dear Dora" written from Richmond. [After June 6, 1862]

scopecontent.p: Inquiry about the family since the Yankees had raided them; Turner as one of the greatly loved Generals; the place where he fell near Harrisonburg.

did.unittitle: Bettie A.[?] Green [cousin] to "My dear Dora" written from Mountain View. March 2nd, [1863?]

scopecontent.p: Dining at Markham [previously Rose Bank, home of the Ashbys]. Acquaintances and health of herself and mother. [Green was D.F.A.'s maiden name.]

did.unittitle: Undated Letters.
Dora to "My Own Dear Sister" [on back:Mrs. George Moncure]. Monday Eve

scopecontent.p: Story of soldier's death at sister's home. Concern for sister's health and Robbie.

did.unittitle: [Dec.] "Dora" to "My Dear Sister" written from Chestnut Hill. Friday Eve

scopecontent.p: Moving back to Ravenswood. Christmas dinner, exhausted after childbirth, impatience with Milly, a black woman.

did.unittitle: D.A.M. [Dora A. Moncure] to "My own Dear Sister" [Mary]. Tuesday night

scopecontent.p: Describes cough and sickness. Neighbors helping, talk of servants leaving but can't get along without one. George is in Mountain View.

did.unittitle: Dora Moncure to "My Dearest Sister" [Mary] written from Ravenswood. Tuesday

scopecontent.p: Newborn baby of Mary; asks her to consider having Miss Eliza Harry come up to take care of the family and nurse the child. Describes food sent.

did.unittitle: Dora to "My Dear Mother". Saturday, the 10th

scopecontent.p: Log of the trip back from Chelsea. Explains house chores and visitors.

did.unittitle: Vic[?] to "Dear Cousin Mary" [on back: Mrs. George V. Moncure Chelsea]. [Undated]

scopecontent.p: Staying with Aunt Ashby; mentions family members; an invitation to come to their house after children's sickness; Dora's baby boy.

did.unittitle: PM [possibly Powhatan Moncure, Dora's husband] to "My Dearest Bet". [Undated]

scopecontent.p: An invitation to D.F. Ashby to come with Dora and convalesce in quietude.

did.unittitle: Photographs.
Two photos of portraits of Turner Ashby--one with "C.W. Alexander" in lower right corner. [Undated]
